taskOptions.description: Use "On" to retain only reads with the same barcodes on both ends of the insert sequence, i.e. symmetric and tailed designs. Use "Off" to retain only different barcodes on each end of the insert, i.e. asymmetric design.
taskOptions.name: Same Barcodes on Both Ends of Sequence

taskOptions.description: Try to infer the used barcodes subset, by peeking at the first 50,000 ZMWs, whitelisting barcode pairs with more than 10 counts and mean score ≥ 45.
taskOptions.name: Infer Barcodes Used

taskOptions.description: Reads below the minimum barcode score are removed from downstream analysis.
taskOptions.name: Minimum Barcode Score

taskOptions.description: If enabled, a separate dataset containing unbarcoded reads will be written.
taskOptions.name: Write Unbarcoded Reads
Use Barcode UUIDs (INTERNAL, NOT FOR CUSTOMER USE)

taskOptions.description: Reads whose barcode scores are below this threshold will be filtered out in the demultiplexed dataset XML files
taskOptions.name: Filter Minimum Barcode Quality

taskOptions.description: If true, lima will ignore BioSample elements in the input SubreadSet XML; this prevents exiting with an error if the annotated barcodes cannot be found.
taskOptions.name: Ignore BioSamples records from Run Design

taskOptions.description: Developer setting, results in additional reporting
taskOptions.name: Testing Mode (INTERNAL, NOT FOR CUSTOMER USE)
